A40091C10B344F0EA44AB2B0DB8BF27F.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

8EC4FF5B5F9D43059748C5AFF2B20D7A.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

8B52E31F0F804A4D98D84C5666AA9E4B.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

458CCFF4F13648AA9D14EC598F6C79CA.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

5327931275534167A61B00CF9AB1B6F3.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

E51CB2BAE1654C7EA13015D46B5B680E.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

3D91F5AD0B03480AB3629052AD5E7C17.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

0E260D0B86654AB48E862DE12423F4A8.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

6E0E90F0A80A44A389CC5EFFB50BC2D5.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

8522D32FC5AD4082AA172C0E97A4B4DD.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

C3CA357841704772BE8C99673C6CF652.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

899CB0C4048341E18191A4E0369E1AFC.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

06F9C110A79C4E0E92837DD844146B81.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

EF1D504030CB4F5F8CF575FB3ABFA239.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

CA50C0976DCB4F85B6680D14DAC2FB09.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

DD486F265B9744388012F5DD314960A0.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

06C6F6135D0245A99012639450D067D3.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

6EC43E64C0C84D69ACF7F04A034E44ED.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

ED7C8F2E7998489BAE53D5476B6B86EB.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

5F195712FF134184BE0FF198EC6F7FBC.description: Apply increasingly proficient autobody techniques, work skills and presentation skills.

A8ADD754DE564945AA543A695554C0F5.description: Develop an intermediate project utilizing guidelines outlined in Module 32.

A9F11A288DDB450BAF11C5927A409065.description: Design and carry out an intermediate project with a self-assessment of the specified skills.

ECE77EDDA4C24F83A0176E00E80158D4.description: Describe the responsibility of sellers when selling automobiles including the ethical and legal implications of selling used automobiles.

F5A889E49DCA41EDB786DA697781B81B.description: Explain the responsibility of buyers when purchasing automobiles, including: the legal implications of purchasing new or used automobiles; factors to consider when selecting appropriate automobiles to meet specific needs/wants; evaluating an automobile’s condition; types of warranty (e.g., limited, extended, manufacturer’s) available to the purchaser; options of purchasing or leasing automobiles; recertification when purchasing tagged automobiles; and, implications of “buyer beware” (e.g., stolen automobile, eligible for registration, liens against an automobile, automobile history).

8899A181B37142B2A78BE6DC6C25CEFA.description: Analyze responsibilities of individuals and businesses when selling or purchasing automobiles.

4D389639A4AB4799B14D007F79B1D7D6.description: Investigate trends in plastic use and the potential impact of electric automobiles on plastic consumption.

FA09759195C449299CD91C9B421BD9DD.description: Discuss different processes and adhesives (e.g., plastic welding, bonding) to repair damage to plastic components.

C2270D5142E0401CBC23AD4AB056906A.description: Conduct a plastic repair to, or above, original equipment manufacturer (OEM) specifications.

D997ED8DBE9C46C282882978BE528381.description: Research, estimate and compare the cost to replace versus to repair plastic components (e.g., bumper repair) in automobile repair.

E4DD561691D940FABC49B3E3AF1B3EFB.description: Research the range of corrective procedures that may be required to repair plastic.

CE61556ED0DE47F2A4DB9D5092BB44AD.description: Identify types of plastics by grinding or locating ISO codes in damaged areas before proceeding with plastic repair.

285E558FD1584C439B7695EEE582388C.description: Investigate the role of plastic in the manufacturing of automobiles.

ACB6DD49382C43FB9CA5735E6C864953.description: Compare different types of plastics (i.e., thermoplastic olefin (TPO), thermo-set, sheet molding compound (SMC), polypropylene) commonly used in automotive construction.

DD0F7DDCB07444F9AE6085AF72EA23CB.description: Analyze plastics in automobile design and carry out plastic repairs.

C9A62AFED8024620AB6F78891DE888C4.description: Examine short- and long-term health concerns related to chemical exposure and demonstrate the appropriate safety procedures when using chemicals.

518B13E44BEC46168CDB86C18495D3E7.description: Examine the environmental effects of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) used in detailing.

F2BDB5285385404A88C440C214286865.description: Determine the appropriate materials, costs and tools to detail the interior and exterior of the automobile.

00B1066EC5754E939AABA81D08475326.description: Analyze operational complications such as the heating and air conditioning (HVAC) system, stained switches and hazy windows on the interior of the automobile in addition to: inspecting the interior and removing after-market attachments that are loose or worn; inspecting the carpet and seats for rips, tears and stains (e.g., soil, grease, chocolate, oil, candy, road tar or blood) and completing necessary repairs; and, inspecting the door and window weather stripping and completing necessary repairs.

AAC0B22222004D94A6290BA2E83DFB6E.description: Complete interior (e.g., vacuuming, brushing, steam cleaning, glass cleaning, leather trimming, re-vacuuming, wiping, perfuming) and exterior (e.g., washing, drying, claying, polishing, sealing) detailing of an automobile in addition to: inspecting the glass and completing necessary repairs; cleaning the chrome with appropriate products; and, inspecting the headlight and turn signal glass, light bulbs and completing necessary repairs.

04E5510592D24B17B6F771FA6392FA32.description: Analyze the interior and exterior condition of an automobile to identify required detailing procedures.

FBFB64542E424E86B9E8C74999C06A8A.description: Assess the interior and exterior condition of an automobile and apply detailing procedures.

31933489CE574D9E854001A14C0E549D.description: Explore the advantages and disadvantages of turning on and off automobile air bag sensors.

EE8A3D2F9FE446A1880C07E3BA4696D0.description: Describe how automobiles are certified to be road safe after a collision.

355DEACE4A9449D780F1EA37B31F478B.description: Compare legislation related to air bags in Saskatchewan with other Canadian jurisdictions.

2C62B4A226044727964DB0C18A8F3210.description: Propose an innovative air bag system, including considerations such as automobile type, rate of deployment, placement of air bag system, laws of motion and injury prevention to automobile occupants.

E7C0B78DB5C54A1F93DF5E08558BE8AE.description: Describe how certified technicians disarm an air bag system prior to repair and re-arm air bag systems when finished a repair.

21DA6B0B1E0948BAB9C3E2766D4FA8B2.description: Describe “safing” and arming sensors to ensure deployment of an air bag when a collision is severe enough to warrant it.

9A61A91F7277497CB07155E07BB0886E.description: Research the evolution of air bag systems in automobiles, including increased safety achieved through each improved design.

07DD22B381064446A5CB0FF0E8D6C11A.description: Identify the location and function of the components of an automobile air bag system.

97B44BD12E6041D7BC6886844DD4E355.description: Examine the evolution of automobile air bags and associated sensors.

D12F660DA1184A478AA8A2FF6FB1A192.description: Investigate issues and potential solutions related to recycling automotive glass.

A7601B5A27FE437680212772953DB65A.description: Practise correct safety procedures such as wearing gloves, long sleeved apparel and eye protection when repairing glass.

22DA112088A34AC2926C19DF8A8D7BEF.description: Demonstrate appropriate use of hand and power tools to repair glass (e.g., windshield, sidelite and backlite).

E9CBB13D41E345BBAC1EB3589EAC04A9.description: Determine required procedures to remove and install glass in an automobile.

978B24F2370F44D1A089EACE75FD4DC9.description: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of using original equipment manufacturer (OEM) and aftermarket automobile glass in repair.

B1641239C1664458B2A1E62780B7A3D9.description: Examine glass damage (e.g., circular bullseyes, linear cracks, crack chips, dings, pits and star-shaped breaks), location of damage (e.g., inside of windshield, deep damage to both layers of glass, complex multiple cracks, very long cracks, contaminated or edge cracks) and identify appropriate tools, materials and procedures to conduct glass repairs.

D2431EF4E8DB47458649949CC048C4D7.description: Research legislation related to approved automotive glass materials.

895610BC342741FEAE5B079DD79819F0.description: Describe the different types (e.g., laminated and tempered) of glass and their purpose in an automobile.

057CD424CA424F9CB4213471202928EC.description: Analyze types and functions of automobile glass and carry out glass repairs.

98AD8162B8B44E8996D49C989A001042.description: Ensure all PPE is cleaned appropriately.

08DF9BE968914AEC8F3B540905722665.description: Identify the purpose and proper use and fit of personal protective equipment (PPE) required for welding, including eye protection (lens shades), clothing, hearing protection and footwear while identifying the hazards from which they protect individuals.

0B15B68610824BE8AD6FF9D9B12F7E69.description: Perform and analyze a variety of specified welds, including plug weld, spot weld, butt weld and lap weld.

108AF4885B5B427CA29979150D940309.description: Identify metals and perform preparation and assembly tasks prior to welding.

F9B3B9ABF235466681192E95D46B6C1E.description: Disassemble, clean and reassemble GMAW welder components.

E34D7565861441AAA4A07F23D63AABE5.description: Compare various types of wire and shielding gases used for GMAW.

BCD902965A9F45D0AE37B4B0FA571BBC.description: Explain the importance of employing correct start-up and shut-down procedures for GMAW equipment including checking and cleaning up the work station.

4DE56FD1E81B4295A9C6DD717EECFF09.description: Demonstrate knowledge of GMAW equipment such as nozzles, contact tips, liners, wire rolls, gauges and flow meters, amperage adjustment and voltage adjustment.

682C5C163DCD45538F8BAA2285661E06.description: Use gas metal art welding (GMAW) equipment to complete specified autobody welds.

7A700907AAD647A98BEA12672BB38962.description: Implement a plan for a safe and healthy classroom and shop environment.

8D0B1825895B475D86B9904E7B7A6BC2.description: Assess the ergonomic design of the work space and implement appropriate procedures to ensure safety.

30C3A40269514834AB6B057167489AFA.description: Apply safe and fair work practices, including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

0DD38DBC8CC74630A747626B8B7C6705.description: Explain the proper procedures to follow to report a workplace injury.

067A6A675B3F46BE8EC812AD831461F9.description: Describe ways to reduce personal injury or material and equipment damage as a result of unsafe work acts or environments.

C769F39BE4274639928B704C29CE4CA2.description: Disconnect batteries and other power sources prior to undertaking autobody repairs where appropriate.

0B886F33E9B34D03B9B74511AD4CC134.description: Assess hazards and apply appropriate safety procedures when working in a confined space.

634345B683154C57B16BC03CBCE1A82D.description: Assess the fire plan for the work area, including components such as fire alarms, fire extinguishers, exits and procedures, and make recommendations for improvements.

D65E2704BD584BBC86EEC9AAD5A2E8A5.description: Identify, label, store and handle hazardous materials according to Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015).

91EFBE92551549DF975CC9FAF2A30A78.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE), including dust masks, approved respirators, coveralls, chemical resistant gloves, eye and hearing protection and footwear.

64E52D1628014C30B7439954453D0371.description: Apply injury prevention principles to ensure safe work performance in the autobody trade.
